parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the failover configuration

parameters.description: The ID of the failover interface configuration

parameters.description: The ID of the failover policy configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the failover rule configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the failover member configuration

interval.description: Number of seconds between each test

flush_conntrack.description: Flush connections on specified action to renew priority of configured interfaces.

track_method.description: Method, how internet connection will be tested.

track_ip.description: The hosts to test if interface is still alive. If this value is missing the interface is always considered up

reliability.description: Number of hosts that must reply for the test to be considered as successful. Ensure there are at least this many hosts defined or the interface will always be considered down.

count.description: Number of pings to send to each host with each test

up.description: Number of successful tests to considered link as alive

down.description: Number of failed tests to considered link as dead

last_resort.description: Determine the fallback routing behaviour if all WAN members in the policy are down
Determine the fallback routing behaviour if all WAN members in the policy are down

proto.description: View the content of /etc/protocols for protocol description

src_port.description: May be entered as a single port or as portrange, e.g. 1024-2048

dest_port.description: May be entered as a single port or as portrange, e.g. 1024-2048

sticky.description: Traffic from the same source IP address that previously matched this rule within the sticky timeout period will use the same WAN interface

weight.description: The ratio values represent a percentage of load that will go through an interface.
The ratio values represent a percentage of load that will go through an interface.
